main event: A silvery, round object was observed by two adult members of the population traveling in a straight line at a constant speed and altitude, passing from East to West in 3 seconds. No other witnesses were found during the investigation.
interesting points: The object appeared to be round, silvery in color, and moved from East to West in 3 seconds.
Two adult members of the population observed the object in the vicinity of 20 degrees in elevation, but no other witnesses were found during the investigation.
The observer immediately began counting and made notes on a scrap of paper concerning the observations.
The object had a greenish-white color similar to that of fluorescent paint on a clock dial in the dark and had a sort of halo around it.
The object was not seen in the two windows to the right, indicating the possibility of a limited field of vision.
sighted object: a silvery, round object traveling in a straight line
witnesses: Two adult members of the population
